intro: Faramea killipii, commonly known as the Killip's faramea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Faramea killipii produces small, dark berries that are edible but not widely cultivated. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
